content: In the question "In your opinion, how do you find the following aspects of Rust?", while I understand from context, some of the phrasings feel like they're inverted or unclear compared to the answers.

"Bugs in the compiler (i.e., ICEs a.k.a. internal compiler errors, miscompilations, etc.)" - well, they're seriously lacking, as in there's a lack of them. And they're not great, they're awful, but fortunately they're rare. :)
(I'm not trying to adversarially misread the survey question, and I did understand from context, but the phrasing did make me do a double-take and make sure I was reading it correctly.)
